text:
Hi!

I’m trying to figure out if I could avoid creating a table to map HubSpot productId with another unique id I have in my other system. According to the documentation I can’t batch update products using `idProperty` , but has anyone figured out a way to solve this?
is there any interesting way to save an array of objects into HubSpot without using HubDB?

can I do this kind of thing in a serverless function?
```  
    let form = new FormData();
    form.append('file',    fs.createReadStream('../example.json'));```
is fs trying to find that file relative to itself?
I should expect source files I create to show up in the design manager right?
seeing extra headers/info around the file
Hi everyone! Is the refresh_token endpoint working?
I got a 404 error while refreshing an active token
Harun, thanks so much for the help. Once again your answer was very informative and helped a lot. Really appreciate it!

Hello, I am having trouble creating a custom object records with an association. When I “Test call” from the Documentation page (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>) it correctly creates the custom object record and associates it to a contact. But when I attempt the same code using a Custom Code workflow action (copy pasta), it creates the custom object record with no error, but does not associate my desired contact to the newly created custom object. Are there any gotchas? Having trouble debugging this issue.
